questions.question_text: Which organelle is the primary site of ATP production in eukaryotic cells?
questions.solution: Mitochondria generate ATP via oxidative phosphorylation.

questions.question_text: Which phase of mitosis is characterized by separation of sister chromatids?
questions.solution: In anaphase sister chromatids separate and move to opposite poles.

questions.question_text: Which macromolecule is synthesized on ribosomes?
questions.solution: Ribosomes translate mRNA into polypeptides (proteins).

questions.question_text: Which hormone is produced by the thyroid gland and regulates metabolic rate?
questions.solution: Thyroxine from thyroid controls basal metabolic rate.

questions.question_text: Which blood cell type is primarily responsible for oxygen transport?
questions.solution: Erythrocytes contain hemoglobin which transports oxygen.

questions.question_text: Which structure in plants controls gas exchange and transpiration?
questions.solution: Stomata allow CO2 entry and water vapor loss; guard cells control opening.

questions.question_text: Which process in plants converts light energy into chemical energy?
questions.solution: Photosynthesis in chloroplasts converts light energy into glucose and O2.

questions.question_text: What is the term for the visible traits of an organism determined by its genotype and environment?
questions.solution: Phenotype is the expressed traits influenced by genes and environment.

questions.question_text: Mendel's law of segregation states that during gamete formation:
options: Alleles segregate so each gamete receives one allele
questions.correct_answer: Alleles segregate so each gamete receives one allele
questions.solution: Law of segregation: paired alleles separate during gamete formation.

questions.question_text: Which organelle contains its own DNA and is involved in aerobic respiration?
questions.solution: Mitochondria have mtDNA and perform oxidative phosphorylation.

questions.question_text: Which class of biomolecules do enzymes belong to?
questions.solution: Most enzymes are proteins that catalyse biochemical reactions.

questions.question_text: Which part of the nephron is primarily responsible for filtration of blood?
questions.solution: Filtration occurs at glomerulus into Bowman's space.

questions.question_text: Which hormone raises blood glucose by promoting glycogenolysis?
questions.solution: Glucagon from α-cells stimulates glycogen breakdown in liver.

questions.question_text: What is the primary pigment involved in photosystem II that absorbs light?
questions.solution: Chlorophyll a is the reaction centre pigment in PSII.

questions.question_text: Which process produces genetically identical daughter cells in plants?
questions.solution: Mitosis produces two genetically identical somatic daughter cells.

questions.question_text: Which vitamin is synthesized by intestinal bacteria and is important for blood clotting?
questions.solution: Intestinal flora synthesize vitamin K which is required for clotting factors.

questions.question_text: Which structure is the female gametophyte (embryo sac) in angiosperms?
questions.solution: Embryo sac (megagametophyte) develops from megaspore in ovule.

questions.question_text: Which process occurs during prophase I of meiosis that increases genetic variation?
questions.solution: Chiasmata formation allows exchange of genetic material between homologues.

questions.question_text: Which macromolecule forms the structural framework of cell membranes?
questions.solution: Phospholipid bilayer makes the basic structure of biological membranes.

questions.question_text: Which is the universal genetic code start codon in mRNA?
questions.solution: AUG codes for methionine and serves as start codon in most organisms.

questions.question_text: Which hormone triggers ovulation in the menstrual cycle?
questions.solution: A mid-cycle surge of LH induces ovulation.

questions.question_text: Which molecule carries amino acids to the ribosome during translation?
questions.solution: tRNA molecules bring specific amino acids matching codons on mRNA.

questions.question_text: Which organ in plants is primarily responsible for water and mineral uptake?
questions.solution: Roots absorb water/minerals and anchor the plant.

questions.question_text: Which blood vessel carries oxygenated blood from lungs to heart?
questions.solution: Pulmonary veins carry oxygen-rich blood to left atrium.

questions.question_text: Which immune cells produce antibodies?
questions.solution: Activated B cells differentiate into plasma cells that secrete antibodies.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a product of photosynthesis?
options: Oxygen is produced; glucose is produced; (choose non-product) Nitrogen
questions.solution: Photosynthesis produces oxygen and sugars; atmospheric nitrogen is not produced by photosynthesis.

questions.question_text: Which enzyme unwinds DNA during replication?
questions.solution: Helicase breaks hydrogen bonds and unwinds the double helix.

questions.question_text: Which kingdom includes organisms that are multicellular, autotrophic and have cell walls of cellulose?
questions.solution: Plants are multicellular autotrophs with cellulose cell walls.

questions.question_text: Which gas is mainly responsible for the greenhouse effect and is produced by respiration and combustion?
questions.solution: CO2 traps infrared radiation contributing to greenhouse effect.

questions.question_text: Which type of RNA carries the genetic information from DNA to ribosomes?
questions.solution: mRNA is transcribed from DNA and translated by ribosomes.

questions.question_text: Which term describes organisms that obtain energy by consuming other organisms?
questions.solution: Heterotrophs rely on organic compounds from other organisms for energy.

questions.question_text: Which of the following structures is unique to prokaryotic cells?
questions.solution: Prokaryotes have a nucleoid region with circular DNA (no membrane-bound nucleus).

questions.question_text: Which process converts atmospheric nitrogen into ammonia biologically?
questions.solution: Nitrogen-fixing bacteria convert N2 to NH3 or related compounds.

questions.question_text: Which organelle is responsible for intracellular digestion?
questions.solution: Lysosomes contain hydrolytic enzymes for digestion of macromolecules.

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes a keystone species in an ecosystem?
options: A species that has a disproportionately large effect on its environment
The most abundant species in the ecosystem
A species with the largest biomass
A species that is the top predator only
questions.correct_answer: A species that has a disproportionately large effect on its environment
questions.solution: Keystone species maintain structure and function despite low abundance.

questions.question_text: What is the primary structural carbohydrate found in plant cell walls?
questions.solution: Cellulose is a β-glucose polymer providing tensile strength to cell walls.

questions.question_text: Which disease is caused by deficiency of insulin?
questions.solution: Diabetes involves impaired insulin production or response leading to hyperglycemia.

questions.question_text: Which structure anchors a plant cell wall to the plasma membrane and contains plasmodesmata?
questions.solution: Middle lamella is rich in pectins and glues plant cells; plasmodesmata traverse it.

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes sympatric speciation?
options: Speciation without geographic isolation, often via polyploidy or niche separation
Speciation due to genetic drift only
questions.correct_answer: Speciation without geographic isolation, often via polyploidy or niche separation
questions.solution: Sympatric speciation occurs within overlapping ranges, often via polyploidy in plants.

questions.question_text: Which structure is the male gametophyte in angiosperms?
questions.solution: Pollen grain develops from microspore and contains the male gametes.

questions.question_text: Which enzyme joins Okazaki fragments on the lagging strand during DNA replication?
questions.solution: DNA ligase forms phosphodiester bonds sealing nicks between fragments.

questions.question_text: Which type of natural selection favors intermediate phenotypes and reduces extremes?
questions.solution: Stabilizing selection reduces variance by favoring intermediate traits.

questions.question_text: Which structure in the heart prevents backflow of blood from ventricles to atria?
questions.solution: AV valves (tricuspid and bicuspid) prevent backflow into atria during ventricular contraction.

questions.question_text: Which cell type in plants stores starch and helps in wound healing and storage?
questions.solution: Parenchyma cells are living, store starch and aid regeneration.

questions.question_text: Which blood component is primarily involved in clotting?
questions.solution: Platelets aggregate and form a plug, interacting with clotting factors to form fibrin.

questions.question_text: Which term refers to an organism's full set of genes?
questions.solution: Genome denotes complete genetic content of an organism.

questions.question_text: Which symbiotic association involves fungi and plants where the fungus aids nutrient uptake?
questions.solution: Mycorrhizal fungi extend root absorption area and provide minerals to plants.

questions.question_text: Which molecule is the direct source of energy for most cellular processes?
questions.solution: ATP hydrolysis releases energy used by cells for work.

questions.question_text: Which organelle is the site of protein modification and packaging for secretion?
questions.solution: Golgi modifies, sorts and packages proteins from RER for secretion.

questions.question_text: Which process in plants moves sugars from leaves to roots?
questions.solution: Phloem transports organic solutes (sugars) from source to sink.

questions.question_text: Which mechanism increases genetic variation by independent segregation of chromosomes?
questions.solution: Homologous pairs segregate independently producing varied gametes.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a water-soluble vitamin important for collagen synthesis?
questions.solution: Vitamin C is a cofactor for prolyl and lysyl hydroxylases in collagen biosynthesis.

questions.question_text: Which animals are endothermic and maintain relatively constant body temperature?
questions.solution: Birds and mammals can generate metabolic heat to regulate body temperature.

questions.question_text: Which type of plant tissue is responsible for primary growth (increase in length)?
questions.solution: Apical meristems at root and shoot tips drive primary growth.

questions.question_text: Which blood group is considered the universal donor for red cells?
questions.solution: O negative lacks A/B and Rh antigens, minimizing transfusion reactions.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a function of smooth endoplasmic reticulum (SER)?
questions.solution: SER is involved in lipid metabolism and detox processes in cells.

questions.question_text: Which condition is characterized by reduced bone density and increased fracture risk?
questions.solution: Osteoporosis involves loss of bone mass, common in elderly or estrogen deficiency.

questions.question_text: Which of the following best defines an ecological niche?
options: The role and position of a species in its environment
The physical location where a species lives only
Only the food sources of a species
Only the predators of a species
questions.correct_answer: The role and position of a species in its environment
questions.solution: Niche includes resource use, interactions, and role rather than just habitat.

questions.question_text: Which structure stores germ cells in the testis where spermatogenesis occurs?
questions.solution: Spermatogenesis occurs in seminiferous tubules within testis.

questions.question_text: Which type of bond holds complementary base pairs in DNA?
questions.solution: A-T pairs form two H-bonds and G-C form three H-bonds stabilizing the helix.

questions.question_text: Which organelle contains digestive enzymes and participates in programmed cell death?
questions.solution: Lysosomes release hydrolases that degrade cellular components during apoptosis/autophagy.

questions.question_text: Which of the following pollination agents is non-living?
questions.solution: Wind is an abiotic (non-living) pollination agent.

questions.question_text: Which cellular junction in animal tissues prevents leakage of materials between cells?
questions.solution: Tight junctions create seals between epithelial cells preventing paracellular leakage.

questions.question_text: Which phenomenon explains the retention of a gene in a population because it confers a survival advantage?
questions.solution: Beneficial alleles increase in frequency due to differential reproductive success.

questions.question_text: Which is the primary nitrogenous waste in mammals excreted in urine?
questions.solution: Mammals convert ammonia to urea in the liver for less toxic excretion.

questions.question_text: Which term describes a group of organisms of the same species living in a defined area?
questions.solution: Population = individuals of same species in a given area.

questions.question_text: Which molecule carries genetic information that can catalyze formation of peptide bonds in ribosomes?
questions.solution: rRNA has peptidyl transferase activity in ribosome catalyzing peptide bond formation.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is true about plasmids in bacteria?
options: They are extra-chromosomal circular DNA that can carry antibiotic resistance genes
They are linear chromosomes essential for survival
They are RNA molecules for translation
questions.correct_answer: They are extra-chromosomal circular DNA that can carry antibiotic resistance genes
questions.solution: Plasmids replicate independently and often carry accessory genes like resistance determinants.

questions.question_text: Which term refers to the maximum number of individuals of a species that an environment can support?
questions.solution: Carrying capacity is the upper limit sustainable by resources and conditions.

questions.question_text: Which organelle is primarily involved in beta-oxidation of fatty acids?
questions.solution: Peroxisomes catalyse long-chain fatty acid oxidation and detoxify H2O2.

questions.question_text: Which blood vessel has the thickest tunica media to withstand high pressure?
questions.solution: Arteries have thicker smooth muscle layer (tunica media) to regulate pressure.

questions.question_text: Which is the main nitrogen assimilatory compound produced during primary nitrogen assimilation in plants?
questions.solution: Ammonia is incorporated into glutamate to produce glutamine via glutamine synthetase.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of adaptive immunity?
options: Memory for faster response on re-exposure
questions.solution: Adaptive immunity is specific and has memory; immediate response without memory describes innate immunity.

questions.question_text: Which of the following best characterizes monocots?
options: Single cotyledon, parallel leaf venation, fibrous root system
Two cotyledons, reticulate venation, tap root system
Single cotyledon, reticulate venation, secondary growth
Two cotyledons, parallel venation, adventitious roots
questions.correct_answer: Single cotyledon, parallel leaf venation, fibrous root system
questions.solution: Monocots typically have one cotyledon, parallel veins and fibrous roots.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the site of aerobic respiration in eukaryotes?
questions.solution: Mitochondria perform citric acid cycle and oxidative phosphorylation.

questions.question_text: Which insect order is primarily responsible for pollination of many angiosperm species?
questions.solution: Bees (Hymenoptera) are key pollinators for many flowering plants.

questions.question_text: Which pigment absorbs light and gives red/orange colours in many fruits and flowers?
questions.solution: Carotenoids are accessory pigments absorbing blue/green light, reflecting yellow/orange.

questions.question_text: Which organ produces bile aiding fat emulsification?
questions.solution: Liver synthesizes bile; gallbladder stores and concentrates it.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a sexually transmitted infection caused by a bacterium?
questions.solution: Syphilis is a bacterial STI caused by Treponema pallidum.

questions.question_text: Which cellular process converts RNA to DNA in retroviruses?
questions.solution: Retroviruses use reverse transcriptase to synthesize DNA from RNA template.

questions.question_text: Which form of selection can lead to speciation by favoring extreme phenotypes?
questions.solution: Disruptive selection favors extremes and can split a population into distinct groups.

questions.question_text: Which term refers to non-random mating where individuals select mates with specific phenotypes?
questions.solution: Assortative mating occurs when individuals choose mates similar to themselves.

questions.question_text: Which structure synthesizes ribosomal RNA (rRNA) in the nucleus?
questions.solution: The nucleolus is the site of rRNA transcription and ribosome assembly.

questions.question_text: Which macromolecule stores genetic information in cells?
questions.solution: DNA stores hereditary information in the sequence of bases.

questions.question_text: Which of the following enzymes adds RNA primers during DNA replication?
questions.solution: Primase synthesizes short RNA primers serving as starting points for DNA polymerase.

questions.question_text: Which organ is the primary site of erythropoiesis in adults?
questions.solution: Red bone marrow produces erythrocytes in adults; fetal liver and spleen also contribute before birth.

questions.question_text: Which genetic cross ratio (phenotypic) is expected from a monohybrid cross between two heterozygotes (Aa × Aa)?
questions.solution: Monohybrid heterozygote cross yields 3:1 phenotypic ratio under simple dominance.

questions.question_text: Which of the following best describes an ecosystem?
options: A community of organisms and their physical environment interacting
A list of species in an area
Only the plant species in a forest
questions.correct_answer: A community of organisms and their physical environment interacting
questions.solution: Ecosystem includes biotic community plus abiotic environment and their interactions.

questions.question_text: Which organelle in plants maintains turgor pressure by storing water and solutes?
questions.solution: Central vacuole stores water and solutes, generating turgor pressure.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is produced during the light reactions of photosynthesis?
questions.solution: Light reactions generate ATP and NADPH used in Calvin cycle to fix CO2.

questions.question_text: Which antigen-presenting cells bridge innate and adaptive immunity?
questions.solution: Dendritic cells present antigen to T cells initiating adaptive responses.

questions.question_text: Which of the following structures is found in prokaryotes but not in eukaryotes?
questions.solution: Prokaryotic ribosomes are 70S; eukaryotic are 80S.

questions.question_text: Which of the following contributes most to primary productivity in oceans?
questions.solution: Phytoplankton conduct photosynthesis and form base of marine food webs.

questions.question_text: Which organ system includes adrenal glands that produce cortisol and adrenaline?
questions.solution: Adrenal glands are endocrine organs secreting steroid and catecholamine hormones.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the functional unit of the kidney responsible for urine formation?
questions.solution: Nephrons perform filtration, reabsorption, secretion and concentration of urine.

questions.question_text: Which virus uses reverse transcriptase to replicate its genome?
questions.solution: Retroviruses reverse transcribe RNA into DNA using reverse transcriptase.

questions.question_text: Which type of chromatography is commonly used to separate pigments for plant physiology experiments?
questions.solution: Paper chromatography separates plant pigments based on solubility and capillary action.

questions.question_text: Which evidence supports endosymbiotic origin of mitochondria and chloroplasts?
options: Presence of their own circular DNA and 70S-like ribosomes
Presence of a double membrane only
Ability to photosynthesize in all mitochondria
questions.correct_answer: Presence of their own circular DNA and 70S-like ribosomes
questions.solution: Organelles retain circular DNA and bacterial-type ribosomes indicative of endosymbiosis.

questions.question_text: Which of the following reproductive adaptations increases offspring survival by parental care?
questions.solution: K-strategists produce fewer offspring with higher parental investment and survival.

questions.question_text: Which technique is used to amplify a specific DNA sequence in vitro exponentially?
questions.solution: PCR uses thermal cycling and DNA polymerase to amplify target sequences exponentially.
